What does it mean to live uncommon? It means using the talent, creativity, faith, and courage God gives each of us to live our lives with purpose. The uncommon life is distinct, uniquely yours, and intentionally about others. We know, because you’ve told us so.
The uncommon nurse with a passion for caretaking
The uncommon child life specialist cheering on through trials
The uncommon parish musician playing a major role behind the scenes
The uncommon radiologic technician desiring a Christ-centered community

CUAA offers music technology and piano presentation ‘Discover Yamaha’
Join Concordia University Ann Arbor for 'Discover Yamaha, a fun and interactive presentation that tells the amazing Yamaha story of innovation and its importance to music for the whole world.
Stepping into 2020: New Year Reflections and Reminders
As we turn the page from 2019 to 2020, let me be one of many who wish you a very happy new year.

From celebrating big wins, to capturing beautiful campus photos, this was a year of significant milestones and achievements for Concordia University Ann Arbor. We had a lot to share in 2019 as we lived out our mission of developing students in mind, body, and spirit for service to Christ in the Church and the world.
What I love most about Concordia is the Christ-centered community. I have never had such great and supportive friends and professors who regularly challenge me and help me grow in my faith.
Compete at the highest levels while growing your faith as a student-athlete.
Live out your faith through service, chapels, small groups and pursuit of your calling.
Expand your artistic vision in the creative and performing arts.

CUAA School of Nursing: Fall 2019 Senior Award Winners
On Saturday, December 14, Concordia University Ann Arbor School of Nursing celebrated the Pinning Ceremony for the Delta Class, the third cohort to graduate from CUAA's school of nursing.

Concordia University Ann Arbor is pleased to take part in the global generosity movement known as #GivingTuesday on December 3. All Concordia dollars raised in the one-day online giving celebration will help to fulfill the university’s greatest financial needs, including operations expenses and scholarships for students.

The latest issue of the Arbor Light includes stories about the vibrant women leading academics at CUAA, attractive options to accelerate the route to graduation, and an alum who seeks to bring the frigid far north into the warmth of Christ’s love.
Editor's note: This blog post by Professor Eric Shanburn is one of a series of posts written by Concordia University Ann Arbor professors to give a behind-the-scenes look into their academic program.

Stepping into 2020: New Year Reflections and Reminders
As we turn the page from 2019 to 2020, let me be one of many who wish you a very happy new year.

From celebrating big wins, to capturing beautiful campus photos, this was a year of significant milestones and achievements for Concordia University Ann Arbor. We had a lot to share in 2019 as we lived out our mission of developing students in mind, body, and spirit for service to Christ in the Church and the world.

2019 was a year of restoration and recognition for Concordia University Ann Arbor. We added a hand-crafted element to our chapel, made Cardinal apparel available online, and received one of the largest grants in university history.
Concordia Choir Christmas CD: On sale now!
A Concordia Christmas CD, recorded in 2019, is a collection of music from Concordia Choir Ensembles. This is a perfect Christmas gift for friends, family, and supporters of CUAA fine arts.
